alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Norton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 8:10PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN NORTON... NORTHEASTERN DECATUR AND SOUTHEASTERN RED WILLOW COUNTIES THROUGH 845 PM CDT... At 809 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lebanon, or 20 miles east of McCook, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Lebanon around 815 PM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for northwestern Kansas...and southwestern Nebraska.
